intro: Cyperus subtrigonus, commonly known as the narrowleaf flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are usually borne on tall, slender inflorescences. Cyperus subtrigonus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
